Bud Light, the longtime top-selling beer in the United States, has recently been dethroned by Modelo Especial. This is due to an online outrage from the right and a boycott that was set off by a transgender influencer's video posted on her Instagram account. The brand is still struggling to win back customers, and this is especially evident in stores, where cases of the beer sit untouched. Anheuser-Busch InBev's stock has also dropped more than 15 percent since early April. The company's chief executive acknowledged that the last few weeks had been “challenging” for the brand. With the summer sales season well underway, it remains to be seen if the slump is temporary or the new normal.

Anheuser-Busch InBev is taking steps to understand and appreciate what consumers want and expect from big brands. They are also working to move the conversation away from the controversy and back to beer. It is clear that the brand is still struggling to win back customers, and the impact of the boycott is still being felt.

  1. Bud Light has been dethroned by Modelo Especial as the best-selling beer in the US.
  2. Sales of Bud Light have declined significantly since mid-April, when a transgender influencer posted a video on her Instagram account to promote a Bud Light contest, setting off online outrage from the right and a boycott.
  3. The volume of Bud Light sold nationally has dropped an average of 29 percent in the four weeks that ended in mid-June.
  4. Anheuser-Busch's stock has dropped more than 15 percent since early April.
  5. The summer sales season is underway and Bud Light is still seeing double-digit declines in volumes nationally.

"It's as if a monarch had been overthrown by a rival, causing their loyal subjects to turn away and their kingdom to suffer a great loss in wealth and power."
